notes: CCHS 2001 restricts BMI to ages 20-64. Consider using using HWTGBMI_der for the most concistent BMI variable across all CCHS cycles. See documentation for BMI_fun() in derived variables for more details, or type ?BMI_fun in the console.

CCHS 2001 and 2003 codes not applicable and missing variables as 999.6 and 999.7-999.9 respectively, while CCHS 2005 onwards codes not applicable and missing variables as 999.96 and 999.7-999.99 respectively
Don't know (999.7) and refusal (999.8) not included in 2001 CCHS
Derived variable from var1, var2, var3
BMI variable derived from the harmonized height and weight variables. See documentation for BMI_fun() in derived variables for more details, or type ?BMI_fun in the console.
